snippet: The agency, which announced an end to Saturday mail service this week, was helped by holiday shipping and election mailings, but its financial woes continued.
abstract: Postal Service, which has announced end to Saturday mail service, posts $1.3 billion loss in first quarter ending December 31, 2012, traditionally one of its strongest periods; reports loss was stemmed by holiday shipping and 2012 election, but total mail volume continues to decline.
lead_paragraph: The agency, which announced an end to Saturday mail service this week, was helped by holiday shipping and election mailings, but its financial woes continued.

headline.main: Post Office Slows Rate of Losses for Quarter
headline.print_headline: Post Office Slows Rate Of Losses For Quarter
